visuals.title: Differentiation and Integration in the FS Domain
visuals.description: Starting from signal x(t) with coefficients X_k, differentiation maps X_k → jkω₀X_k (amplifies high frequencies), while integration maps X_k → X_k/(jkω₀) (attenuates high frequencies).

visuals.title: Differentiation (Highpass) vs Integration (Lowpass) Gain
visuals.description: Differentiation multiplies each harmonic by k (growing with k — amplifies high frequencies). Integration divides by k (shrinking with k — attenuates high frequencies).

visuals.title: Sawtooth Wave: A Signal to Differentiate
visuals.description: A sawtooth wave ramps linearly and then resets. Its linear ramp contains many harmonics. Differentiating it produces impulses at the jumps and a constant between them.

visuals.title: Time Domain: Signal and Its Derivative
visuals.description: A smooth periodic signal x(t) and its derivative x'(t). The derivative is large where x(t) changes rapidly and zero where x(t) is flat.

visuals.title: Integration Smooths: x(t) vs ∫x(t)dt
visuals.description: Integration smooths a signal by attenuating high harmonics. The integral of a square-ish signal looks triangular because sharp edges are rounded off.

visuals.title: Spectrum After Differentiation: High Harmonics Boosted
visuals.description: The original spectrum |X_k| decays. After differentiation, |jkω₀X_k| grows with k, boosting higher harmonics.

visuals.title: Spectrum After Integration: High Harmonics Attenuated
visuals.description: After integration, the coefficients |X_k/(jkω₀)| decay faster than the original. High harmonics are suppressed.

visuals.title: Interactive: Differentiate and Integrate a Signal
visuals.description: Start with a composite signal and apply differentiation or integration. Watch how the harmonic amplitudes change.

visuals.title: Interactive: Coefficient Decay Before and After Operations
visuals.description: Compare the coefficient decay rates of a signal, its derivative, and its integral. Smoother signals have faster-decaying coefficients.

visuals.title: Phase Effects: +90° per Differentiation, −90° per Integration
visuals.description: Differentiation multiplies by jk, adding +90° per operation. Integration divides by jk, adding −90°. The j factor rotates each coefficient in the complex plane.
